results.title: The Dark woods = Les Bois noirs
results.creator_credit: Jacques Deray, Eric Heumann, FR3 Films, Generale d'Images, Mondex Films and Paradis Films
results.brief_description: After a whirlwind romance, Violette, an unemployed actress agrees on impulse to marry Gustave, a charming aristocrat. After the couple returns to Gustave’s estate - an old chateau surrounded by forests, Violette begins to realise that beneath her groom’s charming exterior lies an undreamt of savagery. When she finds herself drawn to his brother, Bastien, Gustave is overcome by jealousy and turns to violence. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Beatrice Dalle, Philippe Volter and Stephane Freiss.

results.title: The Darling buds of May: Christmas is coming
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Peter Norris, ITV and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: An air of excited anticipation is everywhere as Pop trims the huge tree with tinsel and lights while the rest of the family festoon the house with paper chains and Christmas baubles. It’s a time of peace and goodwill to all men and everything should be right with the world. For some in the village, however, there’s little sign of either as Christmas draws near. The Larkins, though, are about to bring happiness to at least one family and put smiles on the faces of two sad little children, with the timely assistance of a certain red-robed and whiskered old gentleman. It’s a time for celebration and everyone is invited to share a truly ‘perfick’ Christmas with the Larkins. Based on the books by H. E. Bates.

results.title: Road without wheels
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Anthony Buckley and Quantum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man on the rim series”.
Part 3 in the series. “The Powerhouse” explores the powerhouse aspect of China’s long history which displays her inventiveness beginning with the Han dynasty. “Pure and simple” shows how the Japanese, despite their close affinity with China, have fought with the utmost determination to remain distinctive. “Road without wheels” In South America, isolated from the rest of the world, the Indians produced their own remarkable range of food, invented the wheel but never used it for transport, and developed their own unique culture.

results.title: The Curse = Xala
results.creator_credit: Ousmane Sembene, Paulin Soumanou Vieyra, Film Domirev and Societe Nationale Cinematographique
results.brief_description: Things are not looking good for rich self-made businessman El Hadj Abdoukader Beye in his third marriage. For starters, there is a huge age difference between him and his wife, whose younger than El Hadj’s daughter. Secondly, he is stricken by a xala, a curse which renders him impotent, on his wedding night. It is through his attempts to cure his condition that writer-director Sembene Ousmane conveys a vivid and satirical image of life in post independence Senegal, and the gap between rich and poor and modernity and tradition. Included as part of Africa95, a nationwide season of the arts of Africa, screened throughout the United Kingdom in 1995. In Wolof and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Into the deep freeze
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Anthony Buckley and Quantum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Man on the rim series”.
This video, the first of four, is about the Pacific Ocean, the people who live around it and across its vast expanse. “First footsteps” explores the theory that the earliest settlers of Australia were perhaps from China. “Hunters and gatherers” describes how the first Australians arrived, occupied and managed their environment. “Into the deep freeze” explains how the people who moved north through China to Siberia coped with the cold and utilised the inexhaustible natural resources. Over two years in the making, this video has breathtaking photography and fascinating narration which illustrate that what we are learning about the Pacific comes from the descendants of the original settlers of this vast area.

results.title: The Dangerous stranger
results.creator_credit: Sid Davis and Sid Davis Productions
results.brief_description: Produced with the co-operation of Inglewood Police Department and Inglewood Unified School District. Designed to impress children with the need to be on guard against molesters. Dramatises places and circumstances under which the child may encounter dangerous stragers under unsupervised conditions and indicates how to avois potential molesters. Human interest, common sense and humour are used, but fear is scrupulously avoided. (Suitable for elementary grades)

results.title: The Last horizon
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Anthony Buckley and Quantum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Man on the rim series”.
Part 4: “The Feathered Serpent” - The Olmec, Toltec, Maya and Aztec cultures represent the highest achievement of American Indian society. This episode shows how these complex communities and their skills in architecture, sculpture and the arts. “The Last Horizon” The final episode in the greatest migratory movement in the history of the human race belongs to the Polynesians. Their epic voyages from Fiji and Tonga carried them to Hawaii, Tahiti, New Zealand and Easter Island. New sails appeared on the horizon from Europe breaking the isolation of the Pacific. Now, there is a new dawning of the Pacific Century.

results.title: Jose: deserted father (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
The story of a deserted father forms one of a series of films created originally for day-time television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies.

results.title: The Cutting edge
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Anthony Buckley and Quantum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Man on the rim series”.
This video, part of a set of four, is about the Pacific Ocean and the people who live around it and across its vast expanse. “Flaming arrows” follows the Siberian hunters who crossed into Alaska and settled America more than 20,000 years ago developing a variety of cultures, arts and technologies. “Changing the menu” watches how the Northern Asians settled into Indonesia and New Guinea, in the process cultivating the new food plants, coconut and rice. “The Cutting edge” traces the technological revolution in Asia which occurred quite independently of those in the original “cradle of civilisation” of the Middle East.
